constitutional_articles.title: Equality before law
constitutional_articles.description: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the laws within the territory of India

constitutional_articles.title: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc.
constitutional_articles.description: All citizens shall have the right to freedom of speech and expression, assembly, association, movement, residence, and profession

constitutional_articles.title: Protection of life and personal liberty
constitutional_articles.description: No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law

constitutional_articles.title: Remedies for enforcement of rights conferred by this Part
constitutional_articles.description: The right to move the Supreme Court by appropriate proceedings for the enforcement of the rights conferred by this Part is guaranteed

constitutional_articles.title: Power of High Courts to issue certain writs
constitutional_articles.description: Every High Court shall have power to issue directions, orders or writs for enforcement of fundamental rights and for any other purpose

constitutional_articles.title: Temporary provisions with respect to the State of Jammu and Kashmir
constitutional_articles.description: Special provisions relating to Jammu and Kashmir (Abrogated)

constitutional_articles.title: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth
constitutional_articles.description: The State shall not discriminate against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth or any of them

constitutional_articles.title: Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment
constitutional_articles.description: There shall be equality of opportunity for all citizens in matters relating to employment or appointment to any office under the State

constitutional_articles.title: Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice and propagation of religion
constitutional_articles.description: All persons are equally entitled to freedom of conscience and the right freely to profess, practice and propagate religion

constitutional_articles.title: Protection of interests of minorities
constitutional_articles.description: Any section of citizens having a distinct language, script or culture shall have the right to conserve the same

constitutional_articles.title: Fundamental Duties
constitutional_articles.description: It shall be the duty of every citizen of India to abide by the Constitution, respect national symbols, protect sovereignty, and uphold harmony

landmark_cases.name: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
landmark_cases.summary: Established the Basic Structure doctrine - Parliament cannot alter the basic structure of the Constitution

landmark_cases.name: Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Expanded Article 21 to include right to live with dignity. Procedure must be fair, just and reasonable

landmark_cases.name: K.S. Puttaswamy v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Right to Privacy declared a fundamental right under Articles 14, 19, and 21

landmark_cases.name: Vishaka v. State of Rajasthan
landmark_cases.summary: Established guidelines for prevention of sexual harassment at workplace

landmark_cases.name: Navtej Singh Johar v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Decriminalized consensual homosexual acts by reading down Section 377 IPC

landmark_cases.name: A.K. Gopalan v. State of Madras
landmark_cases.summary: Narrow interpretation of Article 21 - procedure established by law (later overruled in Maneka Gandhi)

landmark_cases.name: Indra Sawhney v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Mandal Commission case - 50% cap on reservations, creamy layer exclusion for OBC

landmark_cases.name: Shreya Singhal v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Struck down Section 66A of IT Act as unconstitutional - protection of free speech online

landmark_cases.name: Minerva Mills v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Reaffirmed basic structure doctrine, limited Parliament's amending power

landmark_cases.name: Shah Bano Begum v. Union of India
landmark_cases.summary: Muslim divorced woman entitled to maintenance under Section 125 CrPC
